flawed_nl_solution:
Half of Bernie's collection means 18 * 0.5 = <<18*0.5=9>>9 postcards.
So he was able to sell 9 postcards for 9 * 15 = $<<9*15=315>>315.
He decided to spend all of his money on new postcards for $5 each, so he was able to buy 315 / 5 = 63 new postcards.
This means Bernie has 9 + 63 = <<9+63=72>>72 postcards after all.
#### 72

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 135, not 315. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
